com.google.appinventor.components.runtime

Class ListView

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.appinventor.components.runtime.VisibleComponent
      • com.google.appinventor.components.runtime.AndroidViewComponent
        • com.google.appinventor.components.runtime.ListView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Component

    public final class ListView
extends AndroidViewComponent
    ListView Component. Non-Visible component to create a ListView in the Screen from a series of elements added from a comma separated set of text elements. It is similar to the ListPicker component but this one is placed on screen instead of opening a new Activity. TOFO(hal): Think about generalizing this to include more than text/
    Author:
    halabelson@google.com (Hal Abelson), osmidy@mit.edu (Olivier Midy)

        public void AfterPicking()

      • setBackgroundColor

        public void setBackgroundColor(int color)
        Assigns a value to the backgroundColor
        Parameters:
        color - an alpha-red-green-blue integer for a color

      • BackgroundColor

        public int BackgroundColor()
        Returns the listview's background color as an alpha-red-green-blue integer, i.e., 0xAARRGGBB. An alpha of 00 indicates fully transparent and FF means opaque.
        Returns:
        background color in the format 0xAARRGGBB, which includes alpha, red, green, and blue components

      • BackgroundColor

        public void BackgroundColor(int argb)
        Specifies the ListView's background color as an alpha-red-green-blue integer, i.e., 0xAARRGGBB. An alpha of 00 indicates fully transparent and FF means opaque.
        Parameters:
        argb - background color in the format 0xAARRGGBB, which includes alpha, red, green, and blue components

      • SelectionColor

        public int SelectionColor()
        Returns the listview's selection color as an alpha-red-green-blue integer, i.e., 0xAARRGGBB. An alpha of 00 indicates fully transparent and FF means opaque. Is not supported on Icecream Sandwich or earlier
        Returns:
        selection color in the format 0xAARRGGBB, which includes alpha, red, green, and blue components

      • SelectionColor

        public void SelectionColor(int argb)
        Specifies the ListView's selection color as an alpha-red-green-blue integer, i.e., 0xAARRGGBB. An alpha of 00 indicates fully transparent and FF means opaque. Is not supported on Icecream Sandwich or earlier
        Parameters:
        argb - selection color in the format 0xAARRGGBB, which includes alpha, red, green, and blue components

      • TextColor

        public int TextColor()
        Returns the listview's text item color as an alpha-red-green-blue integer, i.e., 0xAARRGGBB. An alpha of 00 indicates fully transparent and FF means opaque.
        Returns:
        background color in the format 0xAARRGGBB, which includes alpha, red, green, and blue components

      • TextColor

        public void TextColor(int argb)
        Specifies the ListView item's text color as an alpha-red-green-blue integer, i.e., 0xAARRGGBB. An alpha of 00 indicates fully transparent and FF means opaque.
        Parameters:
        argb - background color in the format 0xAARRGGBB, which includes alpha, red, green, and blue components
